The Erbil Citadel, locally called Qalat Erbil , and the historical city centre of Erbil in the Kurdistan Region of Iraq.\nThe citadel has been inscribed on the World Heritage List since 21 June 2014

Amadiya is a Kurdish town and popular summer resort and Hill station along a tributary to the Great Zab in the Dahuk Governorate of Iraqi Kurdistan.\nThe city is situated 4,600 feet (1,400 m) above sea level.
Sherwana Castle, also known as Shirwanah Castle, is located in Kalar, Kurdistan, Iraq.

Overview: This is a medium park within the urban area, not so far from downtown and close to Duhok Staduim. It is a good place to take a rest there or to do some sport activities too.

Overview: The site of what is now the Azadi Park used to be a military base during the Ba’ath regime, but after the uprising in 1991, it was converted into a tourism attraction.\nThe park contains several beautiful gardens, a restaurant, a small lake as well as sports areas and playgrounds for children.\nIt is a popular spot for relaxation and enjoyment for local residents.
Overview: Geli Ali Beg Waterfall is located in Iraqi Kurdistan, which lies in the mountainous northern part of the country in the Kurdistan Region, some 130 km north of Arbil.

Overview: Gali Sherana in the province of Duhok has been one of the hottest tourist destination in the Kurdistan Region this summer thanks to its stunning landscape and nature.\nThe place remained untouched until recently.\nThe location resides in the mountains, meaning people have to hike at least for two hours before reaching the spot.
